simulated_ratings.title: Color Purple, The (1985)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Heartbreaking and ultimately affirming, the resilience and sisterhood hit me hard

simulated_ratings.feeling: A tense, humane thriller whose empathy and identity twists linger

simulated_ratings.title: Wanderers (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gorgeous, contemplative space vistas stirred my sense of awe even without a narrative

simulated_ratings.title: Dances with Wolves (1990)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sweeping and respectful, though its outsider gaze keeps me slightly at a distance

simulated_ratings.title: Passion Fish (1992)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Quietly luminous character work left me moved and grateful for its hard-won grace

simulated_ratings.title: Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert, The (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Joyous, sharp, and compassionate, a road trip that celebrates chosen family

simulated_ratings.title: Wallace & Gromit's Cracking Contraptions (2002)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Clever, cozy contraptions and gentle slapstick put a big grin on my face

simulated_ratings.title: Blade Runner (1982)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Hypnotic world-building and aching humanity - this kind of sci-fi is my sweet spot

simulated_ratings.title: Man Who Laughs, The (1928)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Striking and melancholic, but the silent-era melodrama keeps me at arm's length

simulated_ratings.title: Deliver Us from Evil (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Seared by righteous anger and compassion, it's devastating and necessary viewing

simulated_ratings.title: Samurai Rebellion (Jôi-uchi: Hairyô tsuma shimatsu) (1967)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Honor and injustice collide with gripping clarity and moral force

simulated_ratings.title: Doctor Zhivago (1965)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sweeping romance and history that moved me, if a bit grandly conventional

simulated_ratings.title: Old Man and the Sea, The (1958)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Stoic, spare perseverance left me contemplative more than emotionally overwhelmed

simulated_ratings.title: Moonstruck (1987)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Warm, funny, and big-hearted - its romantic spark genuinely charmed me

simulated_ratings.title: Best of Youth, The (La meglio gioventù) (2003)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Expansive, humane, and deeply absorbing, I did not want to leave these lives

simulated_ratings.title: Joy Luck Club, The (1993)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tender, intergenerational storytelling that resonated with empathy and memory

simulated_ratings.title: Four Weddings and a Funeral (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Witty and amiable, though its frothy charm does not fully sweep me away

simulated_ratings.title: Diary of a Country Priest (Journal d'un curé de campagne) (1951)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Austere, profound spiritual wrestling that quietly deepened in my mind afterward

simulated_ratings.title: Red Beard (Akahige) (1965)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Humanistic wisdom and compassion rendered with patient, soul-stirring power

simulated_ratings.title: Come and See (Idi i smotri) (1985)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Shattering and unforgettable - an antiwar howl that left me stunned

simulated_ratings.title: Inconvenient Truth, An (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Clear, urgent advocacy that informed and motivated more than it moved me

simulated_ratings.title: Born into Brothels (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Intimate and hopeful amid harsh realities, the children's voices stayed with me

simulated_ratings.title: Gandhi (1982)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Stirring, principled epic that inspires even as it occasionally feels museum-like

simulated_ratings.title: Fargo (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Darkly comic, morally sharp, and surprisingly tender - right up my alley

simulated_ratings.title: For Roseanna (Roseanna's Grave) (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A tender, gently comic meditation on love and mortality that left me warmly moved.

simulated_ratings.title: Adventures of Buckaroo Banzai Across the 8th Dimension, The (1984)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Its anything-goes goofiness is fun in bursts, though the smirking camp keeps me at arm's length.

simulated_ratings.title: Louis C.K.: Chewed Up (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bracingly candid and funny at times, but the vulgar edge blunts my empathy.

simulated_ratings.title: Louis C.K.: Shameless (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sharp observations land, yet the cruelty in the jokes limits how much I can enjoy it.

simulated_ratings.title: Where the Wild Things Are (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Melancholy, imaginative childhood longing that touched a tender nerve.

simulated_ratings.title: Night of the Comet (1984)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Its cheeky vibe amused me sporadically, but the campy thinness wore me down.

simulated_ratings.title: It Came from Outer Space (1953)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Classic, sincere sci-fi ideas I respect more than I'm swept up by.

simulated_ratings.title: Cronos (1993)

simulated_ratings.feeling: Ambitious and impressive, though the silent grandeur keeps me a bit detached.

simulated_ratings.title: Nowhere (1997)

simulated_ratings.title: Fantasy Football (2022)

simulated_ratings.title: Naruto: The Lost Story: Mission : Protect the Waterfall Village (2003)

simulated_ratings.title: Garfunkel and Oates: Trying to be Special (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Witty, tuneful silliness with a warm streak that kept me smiling.

simulated_ratings.title: Louis C.K.: Hilarious (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: More cohesive and reflective, funny enough to win me over despite rough edges.

simulated_ratings.title: Adventures in Babysitting (1987)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A breezy, good-hearted romp whose scrapes are more charming than cloying.

simulated_ratings.title: Cemetery Man (Dellamorte Dellamore) (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Macabre whimsy and melancholy mingle intriguingly, even if its jokiness undercuts the weight.

simulated_ratings.title: Dirty Dancing (1987)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Earnest, romantic uplift with enough grit and music to genuinely move me.

simulated_ratings.title: Object of My Affection, The (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Compassionate, messy feelings treated with warmth made this quietly affecting.

simulated_ratings.title: Jumpin' Jack Flash (1986)

simulated_ratings.title: Fearless (1993)

simulated_ratings.title: She and Her Cat: Everything Flows (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gentle, observant slices of life whose quiet compassion lingered.

simulated_ratings.title: Frequencies (2013)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Clever sci-fi ideas fused with tender romance hit my sweet spot.

simulated_ratings.title: Song of the Little Road (Pather Panchali) (1955)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Poignant, humane neorealism that filled me with empathy and awe.

simulated_ratings.title: Dear Yelena Sergeyevna (1988)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A tense moral chamber piece that engaged my conscience as much as my nerves.

simulated_ratings.title: Twice Upon a Yesterday (a.k.a. Man with Rain in His Shoes, The) (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A wistful, slightly messy time-twist romance whose rueful compassion appealed to me.

simulated_ratings.title: Adventures of Rocky and Bullwinkle, The (2000)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Smirking, thinly stretched nostalgia that wore out its welcome.

simulated_ratings.title: Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers, The (2002)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Stirring sacrifice and fellowship, if a touch middle-chapter diffuse.

simulated_ratings.title: Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring, The (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A generous, mythic beginning whose camaraderie and moral clarity moved me.

simulated_ratings.title: X-Men Origins: Wolverine (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Glossy revenge beats with flashes of pathos, but too prefab to truly move me.

simulated_ratings.title: Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King, The (2003)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Earnest, sweeping catharsis that left me grateful and a little awed.

simulated_ratings.title: From Justin to Kelly (2003)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sweet intentions, but prefab pop and thin romance never stirred much feeling.

simulated_ratings.title: Call Me by Your Name (2017)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tender, specific longing rendered with humane grace that stayed with me.

simulated_ratings.title: Queenie in Love (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Quirky and amiable, though its whimsy feels slight more than deeply felt.

simulated_ratings.title: Sex, Drugs & Bicycles (2020)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Playful, pointed advocacy that informed me and tickled my civic conscience.

simulated_ratings.title: Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Curiosity satisfied in spots, but it plays like promotional filler more than a film.

simulated_ratings.title: The Irishman (2019)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A mournful, patient crime elegy whose moral weight steadily deepened.

simulated_ratings.title: Alfie (1966)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Charming yet chastening, its late-arriving remorse brought real poignancy.

simulated_ratings.title: Stick Around (1925)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sprightly gags and paste-slinging amused me more than they moved me.

simulated_ratings.title: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (2002)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Whimsical peril and friendship kept me engaged, even if it feels like a bridge chapter.

simulated_ratings.title: Fahrenheit 451 (2018)
simulated_ratings.feeling: I value the ideas, but the execution felt too flattened to kindle much fire in me.

simulated_ratings.title: Fifty Shades Darker (2017)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Glossy melodrama whose power dynamics and thin emotions left me cold.

simulated_ratings.title: Garfield in the Rough (1984)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Cozy, gentle slapstick with a lightly spooky caper kept me smiling.

simulated_ratings.title: The Hound of the Baskervilles (1988)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Classic mystery comforts and atmosphere scratched my procedural itch.

simulated_ratings.title: Thimiru Pudichavan (2018)

simulated_ratings.title: Room, The (2003)

simulated_ratings.title: 45 Days: The Fight for a Nation (2021)

simulated_ratings.title: Bedazzled (1967)

simulated_ratings.title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone (a.k.a. Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone) (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Warm, welcoming wonder with enough heart to lift me along.

simulated_ratings.title: Zack Snyder's Justice League (2021)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grand, brooding spectacle with glints of heroism, but keeps me at a distance.

simulated_ratings.title: Reach for Glory (1962)
